title: Do you think that Riot would ever consider balancing LCS and the main game separately?
body:
It seems really difficult for them to balance both things at once. The most recent example of this is probably the fact that Yuumi got another nerf this patch, despite her low winrate in soloq.
The fact of the matter is some champions just aren't ALLOWED to do well for most of us, just because they work well in LCS!
So yeah, I think they should consider balancing them separately to keep things fair for everyone.

What differences?

I would like to see "pro rules", and I think that we'd have a better game to play, in general.

The things that make a game interesting to watch, are often not the same things that make a game fun to play.

Real sports can do this because they are a set of rules that anyone can work with. LoL cannot do this because it is a confidential, proprietary, closed-source implementation that is its own rule set. To have multiple sets of rules for e.g. basketball, all you have to do is buy your kid a plastic basketball hoop while the pros do whatever they want; the two setups don't interfere with one another. To have multiple sets of rules for LoL, Riot would have to administer and operate multiple versions of LoL.

It's a service, not a sport, so it can't do what sports can.
